docs.snippet: The world's richest cricket board is poised to get even wealthier after media rights to Indian cricket for the next five years brought spirited bidding on Tuesday.

headline.print_headline: Cricket-Media Rights Ensure Another Big Pay Day for Indian Board
headline.main: Cricket-Media Rights Ensure Another Big Pay Day for Indian Board

docs.snippet: India is exploring new duties on the import of a key smartphone component, according to two government sources, the latest in a series of moves aimed at boosting domestic manufacturing in the world's second-biggest smartphone market.

headline.print_headline: India's Electronics Ministry Moots Duties on Key Smartphone Component: Sources
headline.main: India's Electronics Ministry Moots Duties on Key Smartphone Component: Sources

docs.snippet: Chinese smartphone maker OPPO, which has ceded ground to Xiaomi in the Indian market, is looking to take a page out of its Chinese rival's marketing playbook with plans to hold its first online flash sale in the country early next week.

headline.print_headline: China's OPPO Embraces Xiaomi's Flash Sale Gambit to Grow Indian Base
headline.main: China's OPPO Embraces Xiaomi's Flash Sale Gambit to Grow Indian Base

docs.snippet: A security clampdown and a strike sponsored by separatists fighting against Indian rule shut down most of Indian-administered Kashmir on Monday, a day after deadly protests and fierce fighting killed 16 combatants and four civilians.

headline.print_headline: Kashmir Shut by Strike, Security Day After Deadly Fighting
headline.main: Kashmir Shut by Strike, Security Day After Deadly Fighting

docs.snippet: The United States has placed a small Pakistani political party on its list of foreign terrorist groups, calling it a front for the militants behind the 2008 Mumbai attacks.

headline.print_headline: US Adds Pakistan Party to Terror List, Calling It a Front
headline.main: US Adds Pakistan Party to Terror List, Calling It a Front

docs.snippet: Vedanta Ltd, the Indian unit of diversified mining group Vedanta Resources plc, said on Saturday it had won in an auction to acquire bankrupt Electrosteel Steels Ltd.

headline.print_headline: Vedanta Wins Bid to Buy Bankrupt Electrosteel Steels
headline.main: Vedanta Wins Bid to Buy Bankrupt Electrosteel Steels

docs.snippet: Food giants Nestle, Kraft Heinz and Unilever are expected to bid for GlaxoSmithKline's Horlicks health nutrition business, which could fetch more than $4 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.

headline.print_headline: Nestle, Other Food Groups Likely Suitors for GSK's Horlicks: Sources
headline.main: Nestle, Other Food Groups Likely Suitors for GSK's Horlicks: Sources

docs.snippet: Allegations that Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's official smartphone app is shipping Indians' personal data to servers abroad have morphed into a political scandal in a country where privacy rules are weak and the data mining runs rampant.

headline.print_headline: Indian Scandal Brews Over Claim Modi's App Ships Data Abroad
headline.main: Indian Scandal Brews Over Claim Modi's App Ships Data Abroad

docs.snippet: Indian table tennis player Soumyajit Ghosh has been provisionally suspended by his country's governing body after an 18-year-old woman filed a rape allegation against him with the police.

headline.print_headline: Table Tennis: India's Ghosh Suspended Over Sex Crime Allegation
headline.main: Table Tennis: India's Ghosh Suspended Over Sex Crime Allegation

docs.snippet: Two Indian journalists have been killed in separate hit-and-run incidents that rights groups and their families described as deliberate attacks.

headline.print_headline: Media Watchdog: 2 Indian Reporters Killed in Attacks
headline.main: Media Watchdog: 2 Indian Reporters Killed in Attacks
